actions.text: Committee on Finance ordered to be reported an original measure in lieu of H.R.6.
Committee on Finance. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Roth. With written report No. 106-253. Minority views filed.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 484.

official_title: An original bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce the marriage penalty by providing for adjustments to the standard  deduction, 15-percent and 28-percent rate brackets, and earned income credit, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Marriage Tax Relief Act of 2000 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) beginning in 2001, increase the standard deduction for a married couple filing a joint return to twice that of a single individual; (2) phase-in, over a six period, increases in the size of the 15 and 28 percent regular income tax brackets for a married couple filing jointly to twice that of a single individual; (3) beginning in 2001, increase (by $2,500) and provide an inflation adjustment for, phase-out amounts for the earned income credit for a married couple filing jointly; (4) beginning in 2002, permanently extend the provision that permits nonrefundable personal credits to offset both regular and minimum tax liability; and (5) beginning in 2002, repeal the reduction of refundable credits by the alternative minimum tax.

titles.title: An original bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce the marriage penalty by providing for adjustments to the standard  deduction, 15-percent and 28-percent rate brackets, and earned income credit, and for other purposes.
